quest.name: Truths Untold
journal: Who is this unfamiliar woman, and what secrets does she hold?

The woman reveals herself as Cecy, sister to Ellie and the woman behind the phantom thief's many masks. She further tells of her quest for vengeance against Ul'dah for the heinous crime of turning her ancestors into zombies─a historical fact covered up, she insists, by Phillice and her fellow Arbiters. Seeking to deliver revenge by her own hand, Cecy casts a handful of zombie powder at Phillice, only to see the ever-chivalrous Hildibrand take the brunt of the attack in her stead. As all look on with shock and dismay, Hildibrand's mother, Julyan, arrives on the scene. Distressed at the sight of her beloved son in his zombified state, she delivers a violent reckoning to her husband Godbert, whom she holds responsible for Hildibrand's plight, and Gilgamesh, who really just picked a bad time to show up. Fortunately, she takes an instant liking to you, and enlists your aid in saving her son from permanently joining the ranks of the undead. Speak with the imposing matron and see what she has in mind.

Julyan explains that holy water is a well-known remedy for those afflicted with a case of zombie-ism, and assures you that she can fashion a dose from two ingredients─Oversoul rags and twice-distilled water. That said, the cleansing agent must be administered before the ichor has diffused throughout the entire body. With time being of the essence, she sends you and a befuddled Gilgamesh into town to retrieve the necessary materials: the rags from Syntgoht of Syntgoht's Sundries, and the water from a trader by the name of Gest.

A well-timed visit from Avila, the gladiatrix who you and Hildibrand befriended in your recent travails at the Coliseum, proves to be just the ticket in convincing Syntgoht to part with the last piece of Oversoul rags he has in stock. Count your blessings and seek out Gest at the Hustings Strip.

Gest proves to be a thoroughly unpleasant sort who would just as soon see Hildibrand die on account of his dislike for the way the Manderville family conducts its business. Just as all hope seems lost, the most fortuitous appearance of Arabella, the maiden you and Hildibrand befriended at Costa del Sol, has Gest changing his tune, as he begrudgingly parts with a bottle of twice-distilled water in return for a dance with the lapis-tressed beauty. With the two ingredients safely in hand, deliver them to Julyan back at the vault and hope there is still time to save the unfortunate Hildibrand.

Julyan swiftly synthesizes a phial of holy water and administers it to Hildibrand, assuring you that her son is strong enough of will and body to fight off the zombie curse. She promises to see to his care, urging you to go and stop Ellie before she can bring her plan to fruition─using the four relics to break the ancient Sil'dihn seal and drown all of Ul'dah in zombie dust. She further cows Gilgamesh into making another trip to the markets to procure the fire crystals to keep her son's body warm. Gilgamesh stands over a crate of crystals, wistfully recalling old times with his feathered companion. As he delivers a heartfelt plea, a blinding flash of light comes down from the heavens, reuniting the traveling warrior with a long-absent friend...
objectives: Deliver the Oversoul rags and twice-distilled water to Julyan.

dialogue.name: PHILLICE
dialogue.text: I was all but certain that Ellie was our thief. What is the meaning of this!?

dialogue.name: BRIARDIEN
dialogue.text: Another two-layered mask, mayhap? But no...this woman bears a striking resemblance to Miss Ellie.

dialogue.name: GODBERT
dialogue.text: So the letters spoke true─the fiend was in our midst all along.

dialogue.name: HILDIBRAND
dialogue.text: My prodigious powers of deduction scream out to me: this woman knows something!

dialogue.name: CECY
dialogue.text: ...Seven hells. Done in by a muscle-bound muttonhead and his motley troupe of mummers.

dialogue.name: BRIARDIEN
dialogue.text: Just who are you? Your resemblance to Miss Ellie is most uncanny, and yet...

dialogue.name: CECY
dialogue.text: ...Consulting Inspector Briardien. Once again, you fail to measure up to your lofty reputation.

dialogue.name: CECY
dialogue.text: Of course we resemble each other. Ellie is, after all, my own flesh and blood. My beloved sister, and my eminently capable partner in crime.

dialogue.name: CECY
dialogue.text: (-Cecy-)A thousand faces I may wear, but only one name do I bear. You can call me Cecy. Charmed, I'm sure.

dialogue.name: CECY
dialogue.text: (-Cecy-)Are you quite all right? Why, you look as if you've seen a ghost! Despite my moniker, I assure you that Ellie and I are no specters. What we are, mind you, are the last living scions of Sil'dihn aristocracy.

dialogue.name: CECY
dialogue.text: (-Cecy-)Bemused, are you? Befuddled, to find two sisters behind the mask? Try using your brains once in a while. Every time you encountered the thief, Ellie was standing right in your midst.

dialogue.name: CECY
dialogue.text: (-Cecy-)No, the thief that four times stole the show─oh, and those priceless relics─was me. Meanwhile, Ellie hid in plain sight, supplying me with just the knowledge I needed to stay one step ahead of my pursuers, all while spinning the hair-raising tales of my exploits that won the hearts of this nation.

dialogue.name: CECY
dialogue.text: (-Cecy-)We owe a lot to you. Truly! Why, without the tales of your hapless attempts to catch me, we never could have risen to these heights of celebrity!

dialogue.name: HILDIBRAND
dialogue.text: ...Miss Cecy. From a gentleman to a lady, I would ask you one thing and one thing only. Just what is it that you and Miss Ellie hope to accomplish with all of your schemes?

dialogue.name: CECY
dialogue.text: (-Cecy-)Justice! Four hundred years ago, Ul'dahn dogs reduced our great nation to a nation of zombies! At long last, the cowards that would still justify these foul deeds will suffer the same fate!

dialogue.name: BRIARDIEN
dialogue.text: ...Wait. The histories say that it was Sil'dih that turned their own men into zombies.

dialogue.name: CECY
dialogue.text: (-Cecy-)The histories lie! And you work from the shadows, silencing those who would speak the truth! You should have died with your fellows, false arbiter!

dialogue.name: CECY
dialogue.text: (-Cecy-)It was Ul'dah that ordered the creation of that dreadful powder, and wielded it as a weapon against our proud ancestors. The history of your glorious sultanate is built on a lie!

dialogue.name: GODBERT
dialogue.text: What is this madness you speak, woman!?

dialogue.name: CECY
dialogue.text: (-Cecy-)Not madness─truth! The powder in my possession was stolen from the Ul'dahn army four centuries ago by one of my ancestors. They say it was his final act of courage in the moments before his leg fell off and his rotting head dropped from his shoulders.

dialogue.name: CECY
dialogue.text: (-Cecy-)This is the truth that the histories don't tell. The truth that this doe–eyed Sultansworn would kill to keep buried deep in the sands of Thanalan!

dialogue.name: CECY
dialogue.text: (-Cecy-)...But your time of reckoning is nigh. Oh, yes... Before long, you─and everyone in this rotten nation─will know firsthand the horrors my ancestors knew. Ahahaha!

dialogue.name: BRIARDIEN
dialogue.text: And just what do you mean by that?

dialogue.name: CECY
dialogue.text: (-Cecy-)Oh, how the idiots lap up the stories! A masked crusader for justice! A dashing rebel waging battle against power and authority! Oh, if only they knew...

dialogue.name: CECY
dialogue.text: (-Cecy-)But they will see soon enough...when they're eating each other's brains out on the streets!

dialogue.name: CECY
dialogue.text: (-Cecy-)In the last days before our proud nation was razed to the ground, a band of the final survivors stole a vast quantity of the powder from the Ul'dahn vaults, hiding it away in a secret vault sealed with powerful magicks.

dialogue.name: CECY
dialogue.text: (-Cecy-)The sole means by which the vault may be opened? By assembling four secret relics from Belah'dia. Four relics once housed in the royal palace of Sil'dih, before the Ul'dahn dogs stole them and claimed them for their own.

dialogue.name: CECY
dialogue.text: (-Cecy-)...And so it dawns upon you at last. Yes, even as we speak, Ellie makes for the vault, the four relics safely in hand. Just think! One day, you'll be able to tell your grandchildren you were there when zombie powder rained down on Ul'dah. No, wait...you'll all be dead! Ahahaha!

dialogue.name: BRIARDIEN
dialogue.text: Preposterous!

dialogue.name: CECY
dialogue.text: But first, you, my dear. You will not even have the pleasure of looking upon the last moments of your precious homeland. Let your flesh rot like all of your rotten lies!

dialogue.name: HILDIBRAND
dialogue.text: I think not, Miss Cecy!

dialogue.name: BRIARDIEN
dialogue.text: Hildibrand!

dialogue.name: CECY
dialogue.text: You idiot! Just for once, could you not get in the way!?

dialogue.name: HATENA
dialogue.text: (-???-)Godbert Manderville! I can't even trust your sorry arse to look after him for a day!

dialogue.name: JULYAN
dialogue.text: Godbert Manderville! Can I not even trust yer sorry arse to keep an eye on our dear boy for a bloody day!?

dialogue.name: GODBERT
dialogue.text: I knew it! That presence watching over us from the shadows... It was you, my dear wife!

dialogue.name: BRIARDIEN
dialogue.text: ...Ahem. Am I to understand that you are Hildibrand's...mother?

dialogue.name: GILGAMESH
dialogue.text: Aye, this is more like it! Hand to hand, skillet to skillet...it's enough to send a warrior's pulse racing! Prepare yourself, Forename! The time of our final confrontation is nigh!

dialogue.name: JULYAN
dialogue.text: Do ye have popotoes for brains, you overstuffed buffoon!? My beloved boy's been turned into a stinkin' corpse, if ye hadn't bloody noticed!

dialogue.name: JULYAN
dialogue.text: You! Forename or somethin', was it!?

dialogue.name: JULYAN
dialogue.text: Hildy's told me all about your high jinks together. Pleased to meet ye!

dialogue.name: JULYAN
dialogue.text: My dear boy's always had a bit of a rebellious streak. What can I say? I can come on a bit too strong at times.

dialogue.name: JULYAN
dialogue.text: But can ye blame me!? This time I thought I'd sit back and leave things to my sorry-arse husband here, and look what that got me! You'll help me out, won't ye?

dialogue.name: PHILLICE
dialogue.text: Inspector Hildibrand's...mother?

dialogue.name: BRIARDIEN
dialogue.text: I daresay it's quite clear who wears the pants in the family...so to speak.

dialogue.name: JULYAN
dialogue.text: Reunited with my dear boy for the first time in ages, and just look at him! He's...green!

dialogue.name: JULYAN
dialogue.text: Fortunately, there's still time to reverse the zombie curse, and I know just the remedy: a phial o' holy water. The ingredients are simple: a tatter of Oversoul rags and a phial of twice-distilled water.

dialogue.name: JULYAN
dialogue.text: Syntgoht at the markets stocks the former, and the latter you can procure from a trader by the name o' Gest. Now hurry! Once the poison spreads throughout his veins, no antidote'll save him.

dialogue.name: BRIARDIEN
dialogue.text: In the meantime, I will search for the bumbler's bumbling assistant. With any luck, Miss Nashu is still alive.

dialogue.name: GILGAMESH
dialogue.text: Ouch! That smarts. Ye gads, Hildy─you're looking none too hearty yourself!

dialogue.name: JULYAN
dialogue.text: No thanks to you, you bumbling oaf! Now, are ye going to accompany Forename here and make yourself useful, or do I have to reintroduce you to that wall!?

dialogue.name: GILGAMESH
dialogue.text: Er, ah...b-but of course, milady, Gilgamesh is ever at your service. Syntgoht's Sundries, was it? Come now, Forename! There is work to be done!

dialogue.name: JULYAN
dialogue.text: A piece of Oversoul rags from Syntgoht's Sundries and a bottle of twice-distilled water from the trader Gest! Now hurry, godsdammit─my dear boy's life is at stake!

dialogue.name: SYNTGOHT
dialogue.text: Oversoul rags, you say? I fear that I've only a single tatter left in stock, and it's already been spoken for.

dialogue.name: GILGAMESH
dialogue.text: But, my good man, you must reconsider! My dear friend's life─and quite possibly mine own as well─hangs in the balance!

dialogue.name: SYNTGOHT
dialogue.text: I sympathize with your plight, friend, but a man has to make a living. I've been promised a copious supply of rare chimera membrane for these rags. Unless you can offer me the same, no deal.

dialogue.name: GILGAMESH
dialogue.text: Gah! And you expect us to be able to summon such a rarity out of nowhere at a moment's notice!?

dialogue.name: AVILA
dialogue.text: (-???-)...Well, look what we have here. If it isn't the Warrior of Light from the Coliseum. Funny who you meet at the markets.

dialogue.name: AVILA
dialogue.text: As it happens, I just returned from my training, and the slaying of ten chimeras just happened to be my task for the day. If it's chimera membrane you seek, you're more than welcome to a share.

dialogue.name: GILGAMESH
dialogue.text: My lady! You are far too kind!

dialogue.name: AVILA
dialogue.text: Don't mention it. If it hadn't been for Inspector Hildibrand and Forename here, I'd still be tag teaming with that slimy beast and cheating my way to fame and fortune. ...And I'm a woman who pays her debts.

dialogue.name: SYNTGOHT
dialogue.text: Thal take me if that wasn't Avila the Tempest! Ever since she confessed to her trickery and started climbing back up from the bottom of the ranks, I've been proud to call myself one of her biggest fans. Why, I've half a mind to give you the rags you seek simply for the privilege of meeting her!

dialogue.name: GILGAMESH
dialogue.text: A kind sentiment, my good man, but we are more than happy to uphold our side of the bargain─aren't we, Forename? And with this, our task here is done. Now, let us find this trader named Gest!

dialogue.name: SYNTGOHT
dialogue.text: Why did you not tell me that you knew Avila the Tempest, friend!? Say, do you suppose you could come by front row seats for her upcoming bout?

dialogue.name: GEST
dialogue.text: The blundering Manderville boy is on his last legs and you need something of mine to save him, you say?

dialogue.name: GEST
dialogue.text: Hmph... Perhaps you can give me a good reason why I should care. Those bloody Mandervilles are richer than the Traders Themselves, yet they have the audacity to haggle me down to the last gil for every purchase. If the family line ended today, I'd be a happier─and wealthy─man.

dialogue.name: GEST
dialogue.text: ...And now, I believe the ballroom calls. Good day to you, and do pass along my condolences to the grieving parents.

dialogue.name: GILGAMESH
dialogue.text: Have you not a shred of honor or compassion in that spindly body!? Business rival or no─the man is on death's doorstep!

dialogue.name: VANNES
dialogue.text: (-???-)After the events of that day, my father will not so easily forgive and forget─but it matters not to me. No, my love for you is as deep as the seven seas! I beg of you, milady, may I have this dance?

dialogue.name: ARABELLA
dialogue.text: Forename! What a lovely surprise. Are you here for the ball, perchance?

dialogue.name: ARABELLA
dialogue.text: Heavens! The poor inspector...

dialogue.name: GEST
dialogue.text: Well, if it isn't the lapis maiden in the flesh! What say you bid farewell to preening fops and scruffy adventurers and share a dance with a cultured gentleman befitting your great beauty?

dialogue.name: ARABELLA
dialogue.text: Why, it would be a pleasure and an honor both, milord.

dialogue.name: ARABELLA
dialogue.text: ...Provided you first provide my good friend Forename with the bottle of twice-distilled water that shehe seeks.

dialogue.name: GEST
dialogue.text: Y-You know this womanman!? Bah...if that is the price you would set, then so be it. Take it─it's barely worth its weight in gil, anyway. Now, shall we, Miss Arabella?

dialogue.name: GILGAMESH
dialogue.text: I knew Hildy to be a worthy rival, but to think he was this beloved by so many! Clearly, this realm would deeply mourn his loss. Quickly, Forename! Let us deliver these goods while there is still time to save him!

dialogue.name: JULYAN
dialogue.text: ...I trust the two of ye wouldn't dare to come back empty-handed!?

dialogue.name: JULYAN
dialogue.text: Bloody brilliant! Aye, I'd take you over my muscle-headed half-wit of a husband any day!

dialogue.name: JULYAN
dialogue.text: Now, stand back and let me show you some real Manderville home cookin'!

dialogue.name: JULYAN
dialogue.text: Thal, Ye bloody bugger, guide my skillet!

dialogue.name: JULYAN
dialogue.text: Aye, that should stop its spread. Now it's up to Hildy to flush what's left out o' his system. Don't worry, he's my son, after all─I reckon he's still got some fight left in him.

dialogue.name: BRIARDIEN
dialogue.text: Look who I found. She was slumbering obliviously in a rubbish-strewn corner of Pearl Lane.

dialogue.name: NASHUMHAKARACCA
dialogue.text: Boy, did that nap feel good!

dialogue.name: BRIARDIEN
dialogue.text: ...Yes, I'm sure it did. Forename. Word has it that Ellie has been sighted at the Sil'dihn ruins. We must go there with all haste.

dialogue.name: JULYAN
dialogue.text: Ye've done well by my dear boy today. Don't worry, I'll handle things from here. There's a nice warm bed for him, and I think I know a few specialists who might know a thing or two about his condition.

dialogue.name: JULYAN
dialogue.text: ...What in the seven hells are ye standin' around for!? The future of Ul'dah is at stake!

dialogue.name: GILGAMESH
dialogue.text: ...Forename. My strength is yours as well. For Ul'dah...and for our friend Hildy!

dialogue.name: JULYAN
dialogue.text: You! You remind me o' my husband, what with ye havin' more muscles than sense. If yer so keen on makin' yerself useful, why don't ye run to the markets and bring me some fire crystals?

dialogue.name: JULYAN
dialogue.text: Keepin' my dear boy warm is key to fightin' off the zombification. Let's see...I believe twenty crates or so should suffice.

dialogue.name: GILGAMESH
dialogue.text: I-I am a warrior, not an err─ah...y-yes, milady!

dialogue.name: GILGAMESH
dialogue.text: I say, Enkidu! The burden we must bear simply to secure my long-awaited final confrontation with Forename...

dialogue.name: GILGAMESH
dialogue.text: That said, the events of today have given me cause to reflect. Forename and Hildy both─oh, to be blessed with such veritable legions of friends tried-and-true!

dialogue.name: GILGAMESH
dialogue.text: But alas, not I! No... Only one true friend have I ever known, and she is long lost to me...

dialogue.name: GILGAMESH
dialogue.text: You are a fine bird, and have given me great comfort in my travels. But you will never be Enkidu, my one and true companion! Oh, my friend! Were you here with me, even Forename could not stand against our combined might!

dialogue.name: GILGAMESH
dialogue.text: O, Enkidu, wherever you may wander! Hear my words, and return here to my side! Enkidu, do you hear me!? ENKIIIDUUUUUUUUUUUU!

dialogue.name: GILGAMESH
dialogue.text: Ye gads! What was that flash from the heavens? It nearly blinded me! And...what!? The crystals! Where have they gone!?

dialogue.name: ENKIDU
dialogue.text: (-???-)Fancy meeting you here...old friend.

dialogue.name: GILGAMESH
dialogue.text: That voice... Could it be...!?

dialogue.name: GILGAMESH
dialogue.text: My faithful companion... Why must you always make me wait so!?
